body: This particular combination is tested in test 1634 and it's expected to return 0. I don't quite see the rationale for that, though.

issue.title: tool_operate: fix return code when --retry is used but not triggered

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Verify with test 752

Reported-by: fjaell on github
Fixes #17554

body:
> This particular combination is tested in test 1634 and it's expected to return 0. I don't quite see the rationale for that, though.

Test 1634 tests a different scenario. It actually retries the transfer and then succeeds, which is why it does and should return zero.

issue.title: Handle curl 8.14.0 zero-exit bug
issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/install-scripts/issues/610
Related to https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/17554.

Curl 8.14.0 was returning a zero-exit code even when the output indicated a failure, such as curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404. This behavior resulted in failures as described in https://github.com/dotnet/install-scripts/issues/610.

issue.title: dotnet-install.sh fails with curl 8.14.0
issue.body:
Issue Summary: When installing .NET using the dotnet-install.sh script, the installation fails with the error:
`/usr/local/bin/dotnet-install.sh: line 1380: link_types[$link_index]: unbound variable`
This issue started occurring after upgrading `curl` from version `8.13.0` to `8.14.0`.

Environment:
Base Image: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 8
Shell: /bin/sh (within Docker build)
dotnet-install.sh  Source: Private GitHub Proxy Repository
Previous curl Version (Working): 8.13.0
Current curl Version (Failing): 8.14.0


Steps to reproduce: 
Build a Docker image using RHEL 8 as the base.
Add custom `curl`  and `dotnet` installation:

```docker
RUN CURL_SOURCE_URL=$(curl -sSL https://api.github.com/repos/curl/curl/releases/latest | jq -r '.assets[] | select(.name | endswith(".tar.gz")) | .browser_download_url' | sed 's/github\.com/some-private-repository\/repository\/github-proxy/') \
  && curl -sSL $CURL_SOURCE_URL -o curl.tar.gz \
  && tar -xzf curl.tar.gz \
  && rm -f curl.tar.gz \
  && CURL_LOCATION=$(ls -d curl-*/) \
  && pushd ${CURL_LOCATION} \
  && ./configure \
  --enable-static --disable-shared \
  --with-openssl --with-brotli --with-zstd \
  --with-nghttp2 \
  --with-libidn2 --with-libssh2 \
  --enable-hsts --enable-mime --enable-cookies \
  --enable-http-auth --enable-manual \
  --enable-proxy --enable-file --enable-http \
  --enable-ftp --enable-telnet --enable-tftp \
  --enable-pop3 --enable-imap --enable-smtp \
  --enable-gopher --enable-mqtt \
  --enable-doh --enable-dateparse --enable-verbose \
  --enable-alt-svc --enable-websockets \
  --enable-ipv6 --enable-unix-sockets --enable-socketpair \
  --enable-headers-api --enable-versioned-symbols \
  --enable-optimize --enable-pthreads \
  --enable-warnings --enable-werror \
  --enable-curldebug --enable-dict --enable-netrc \
  --enable-bearer-auth --enable-tls-srp --enable-dnsshuffle \
  --enable-get-easy-options --enable-progress-meter \
  --with-ca-bundle=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.crt \
  --with-ca-path=/etc/ssl/certs \
  --with-ca-fallback \
  --disable-ldap --disable-ldaps \
  && make \
  && make install \
  && popd \
  && rm -rf ${CURL_LOCATION}

# Install dotnet:

curl --retry 10 --retry-all-errors -sSL https://some-private-repository/repository/github-proxy/dotnet/install-scripts/archive/refs/heads/main.zip -o dotnet-install.zip && \
unzip -j dotnet-install.zip install-scripts-main/src/dotnet-install.sh -d /usr/local/bin && \
rm -f dotnet-install.zip && \
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/dotnet-install.sh && \
dotnet-install.sh -c 8.0 && dotnet-install.sh -c 9.0 && \`
dotnet --info
```

Output for curl  installation 8.14.0 : 

```
#17 9.941 Complete!
#17 10.05 curl 8.14.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.14.0 OpenSSL/1.1.1k-fips zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.0.6 zstd/1.4.4 libpsl/0.20.2 libssh2/1.11.1
#17 10.05 Release-Date: 2025-05-28
#17 10.05 Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
#17 10.05 Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli HSTS HTTPS-proxy IPv6 Largefile libz NTLM PSL SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP TrackMemory UnixSockets zstd
#17 DONE 10.1s
```

Output for donet  installation : 
```
#21 1.419 Archive:  dotnet-install.zip
#21 1.419 28ba87d0c95854ac6255659209364b7c2b0130e8
#21 1.424   inflating: /usr/local/bin/dotnet-install.sh  
#21 8.137 /usr/local/bin/dotnet-install.sh: line 1380: link_types[$link_index]: unbound variable
#21 ERROR: process "/bin/sh -c curl --retry 10 --retry-all-errors -sSL https://some-private-repositoryt/repository/github-proxy/dotnet/install-scripts/archive/refs/heads/main.zip -o dotnet-install.zip   && unzip -j dotnet-install.zip install-scripts-main/src/dotnet-install.sh -d /usr/local/bin   && rm -f dotnet-install.zip   && chmod +x /usr/local/bin/dotnet-install.sh   && dotnet-install.sh -c 8.0   && dotnet-install.sh -c 9.0   && dotnet --info " did not complete successfully: exit code: 1
```

Output using `curl` 8.13.0.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eea27f17-f679-4e53-bb52-b38a3731a2f3)

issue.title: curl -f --retry 2 returns exit code 0 on authentication error

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

Tested with curl 8.14.1 from debian unstable.
curl -f http://httpbin.org/basic-auth/foo/bar
gives exit code 22.
With --netrc in addition, the exit code is 26.
Adding --retry 2, e.g.
curl -f --retry 2 http://httpbin.org/basic-auth/foo/bar
always gives exit code 0
--retry-all-errors does not seem to have this issue.
curl 8.13 on macOS does not seem to have this issue, so likely a regression?

### I expected the following

Exit code correctly corresponds to success or failure

### curl/libcurl version

curl 8.14.1 (aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.14.1 OpenSSL/3.5.0 zlib/1.3.1 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.7 libidn2/2.3.8 libpsl/0.21.2 libssh2/1.11.1 nghttp2/1.64.0 nghttp3/1.8.0 librtmp/2.3 OpenLDAP/2.6.10
Release-Date: 2025-06-04, security patched: 8.14.1-1
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtmp rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd

### operating system

Linux vbox 6.12.30-arm64-16k #1 SMP Debian 6.12.30-1 (2025-05-28) aarch64 GNU/Linux

issue.body:
Due to curl/curl#17554 curl is not returning an error code on a failed call that was invoked with the `--retry` flag.

We temporarily revert to curl `v8.13.0` until the fix gets released.

issue.title: cmake: cannot execute: required file not found

repository.name: qbittorrent-nox-static
repository.description: A bash script which builds a fully static qbittorrent-nox binary with current dependencies to use on any Linux OS

issue.body:
### What's wrong?

My main system is Ubuntu 24.04. I'm running the script in docker using the Alpine version of the bootstrapping command at https://userdocs.github.io/qbittorrent-nox-static/script-installation/
I followed the prerequisite checklist at the same site. Running the script, an error occurs.
`/root/qbt-build/bin/cmake: cannot execute: required file not found`
The script previously reports cmake as green (check passed)

The command and output below. I can provide entire log file from qbt/qbt-build/logs/ as appropriate.

```bash
35cf143c0bd8:~# ./qbittorrent-nox-static.sh all

  Checking if required core dependencies are installed

  autoconf
  automake
  bash
  bash-completion
  build-base
  curl
  git
  pkgconf
  libtool
  perl
  python3
  python3-dev
  py3-numpy
  py3-numpy-dev
  linux-headers
  ttf-freefont
  graphviz
  cmake
  re2c

  Dependencies: All checks passed, continuing to build

  Test URL = passed

  Script version: 2.0.18

  Install Prefix : ~/qbt-build

  Script help : ~/qbittorrent-nox-static.sh -h

  Checking if cmake and ninja need to be installed

  cmake and ninja are installed and ready to use

  Downloading zlib using source files to /root/qbt-build/zlib.tar.xz - https://github.com/zlib-ng/zlib-ng/archive/refs/heads/develop.tar.gz

  Patching from remote:patch - zlib 1.3.1 - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/userdocs/qbittorrent-nox-static/master/patches/zlib/1.3.1/patch

./qbittorrent-nox-static.sh: line 2615: /root/qbt-build/bin/cmake: cannot execute: required file not found
./qbittorrent-nox-static.sh: line 2623: /root/qbt-build/bin/cmake: cannot execute: required file not found

  Error: The build command produced an exit code greater than 0 - Check the logs 

  Warning: Developers can be easily startled or confused by wild issues, if you are seeing this warning and cannot resolve the issue yourself, please open an issue at this repo first:

  https://github.com/userdocs/qbittorrent-nox-static/issues 

35cf143c0bd8:~# 
```

issue.title: fix: python tag in predicted wheel URLs

repository.name: poetry2nix
repository.description: Convert poetry projects to nix automagically [maintainer=]

issue.body:
**Partially fixes #1920:** fetches wheels from valid predicted URLs for most packages.

Still fails to fetch some weird wheels, e.g. [DAWG-Python](https://pypi.org/project/DAWG-Python/#DAWG_Python-0.7.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl), because of issue curl/curl#17554 fixed in curl 8.15 that is going to be merged into nixpkgs in NixOS/nixpkgs#425701.

[Contribution](https://github.com/nix-community/poetry2nix/blob/master/README.md#contributing) checklist (recommended but not always applicable/required):

- [ ] There's an _[automated test](https://github.com/nix-community/poetry2nix/blob/master/tests/default.nix)_ for this change
- [ ] Commit messages or code include _references to related issues or PRs_ (including third parties)
- [x] Commit messages are _[conventional](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/)_ - examples from [the log](https://github.com/nix-community/poetry2nix/commits/master) include "feat: add changelog files to fixup hook", "fix(contourpy): allow wheel usage", and "test: add sqlalchemy2 test"

body:
= [Outdated] "--retry" may interfere shell exit status? =

  E.g.
  `curl --retry 0 "https://127.0.0.1:23456/"`
  `curl --retry 1 "https://127.0.0.1:23456/"`
  .
  Which should normally cause Connection Refused, thus "curl: (7)".
  While with ["--retry"](https://curl.se/docs/manpage.html#--retry) active the shell exit status (e.g. ["$?"](https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9799919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html#tag_19_05_02)) won't be normally set.
  Adding "--retry-all-errors" seemed to correct the behavior.
  (though which tends to be problematic)

issue.title: Status 78 is not reported to the calling batch

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

When downloading a file using the FTPS protocol that does not exist on the FTPS server, the calling batch is returned with a status of 0 instead of the correct status of 78.

### I expected the following

It must return the correct status 78 to the calling batch as it has always done for all previous versions.

### curl/libcurl version

CURL Ver. 8.14.1, installed on Windows 11 2024 H2 with the August Windows Update (KB5063878).

### operating system

CURL Ver. 8.14.1, installed on Windows 11 2024 H2 with the August Windows Update (KB5063878).
